'''''Minecraft Reality''''' was a discontinued {{w|augmented reality}} app for iOS developed by [[13th Lab]] and released around November 25, 2012.<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20121127183203/http://mojang.com/2012/11/announcing-minecraft-reality-for-ios/ Announcing Minecraft Reality for iOS] on the archived [[Mojang blog]]</ref><ref>[https://mcupdate.tumblr.com/post/37898999784/minecraft-reality-now-available-for-ios Minecraft Reality Now Available for iOS] on [[MCUpdate]]</ref><ref>[https://www.iclarified.com/25843/minecraft-reality-app-released-for-ios Minecraft Reality App Released for iOS]</ref> Users could use the official ''Minecraft Reality'' website to upload their own creations to the app. These models could then be found in the app, among creations from other users. The app could then be used to place the 3D models into the real world, similarly to ''[[Minecraft Earth]]''.

== Purchase and availability ==
''Minecraft Reality'' was available for purchase on the {{Wikipedia|App Store}} for $1.99 until January 2014.{{verify}}

The game was available on the following devices:<ref>{{citation|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140816130454/https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/minecraft-reality/id577991556?ls=1&mt=8|title=Minecraft Reality on the App Store on iTunes|website=web.archive.org}}</ref>
* {{w|iPhone}}
* {{w|iPad}}
* {{w|iPod Touch}}

== Gameplay ==
Upon entering the app, a menu was shown with several built-in creations, in which the user could either press the button "Place a Creation" or "Place" in the page of the model to place a creation. The app then utilized the smartphone's camera in order to let the user combine ''Minecraft'' creations with the real world.
